intro: Gomesa bifolia, commonly known as the two-leaved gomesa, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its distinctive two-lobed leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid forests. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
